Container.Name: RA-ROM-Processor
Container.Overview: RA ROM Processor is a Docker container that is used to download/orgainze/process/verify/dedupe/scrape a ROMs library automatically by matching ROMs to the RetroAchievement.org website Hash database.

Config.Name: Host Path for /input
Config.Description: Place ROMs to be processed in this directory

Config.Name: Host Path for /output
Config.Description: ROMs that have been processed will end up here

Config.Name: Host Path for /backup
Config.Description: Processed ROMs are backed up to this directory

Config.Name: Enable Automatic Script Start
Config.Description: true = Enabled :: Runs script automatically on startup

Config.Name: Script Interval
Config.Description: #s or #m or #h or #d :: s = seconds, m = minutes, h = hours, d = days :: Amount of time between each script run, when AUTOSTART is enabled

Config.Name: DeDupe ROM Library
Config.Description: true = Enabled :: This setting further reduces the final ROMs list per platrom, by removing duplicates with the priority of: USA > Europe > World > Japan, and then by shortest filename when multiples exist

Config.Name: Aquire ROM Sets
Config.Description: true = Enabled :: Enabling this will have the script attempt to pull valid ROM sets from archive.org for processing

Config.Name: Concurrent Download Threads
Config.Description: Number of concurrent threads to increase download speed... only aplicable if AquireRomSets is enabled (true)

Config.Name: Enable Unsupported Platforms
Config.Description: true = Enabled :: Enabling this will allow the script to import and scrape ROMs for platforms without RA hashes, no deduping/validation is performed

Config.Name: Scrape Metadata
Config.Description: true = Enabled :: Enabling this will allow the script to process the ROMs with skyscraper
